body.p:
To his excellency Beriah Magoffin
Govr. of the Comth of Ky
Your petitioners state that at the Sept Term 1861 of the Henry Circuit Court Jacob Sagresy was fined Forty Dollars for Keeping a Tippling House in the County of Henry=

We say to your honor that he is an honest man disabled from labor by a chronic disease which renders him almost helpless. he has a large family of small children. And scarcely any means at all to obtain for them, a support --
For the reasons above stated. And in view of the general pecuniary embarassment of the Country We cheerfully ask your honor to interpose Your executive power. and remit the fine

M. B Pearce
W D Owen Shriff,
B Allen D. S. H. C
W. J. Thomas D. Clerk
J. M. Jones Jailor H. C
J. S. Drane
O P Thomas W D Clerk
E. P. Thomas Clerk H. C

P U Major Esqr.
Dear Sir
Will you oblige me by delivering this petition if consistent with your feelings. A word of favor I know will be kindly remembered by Mr. Sagresy.
